message: Have a safe, happy, and wonderful New Year!
It is an honor and a privilege to serve the constituents of the Second Congressional District of West Virginia for a second term. #115thCongress #WV2

It is an honor to be asked to serve on the House Committee on Financial Services. Financial Services oversees some of the most important economic issues facing West Virginia, including our community banking system, insurance, and housing policy. This important committee assignment will give me a greater platform to expand financial opportunities in rural areas and for the great state of West Virginia.  https://mooney.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/congressman-alex-x-mooney-wv-2-appointed-important-house-financial

A record number of Americans are no longer in the labor force. This is a direct result of Obama’s job killing policies and mandates. I will work with my colleagues in Congress and President-Elect Trump to help roll back the damage that this administration has done on industries like coal and fossil fuels.  http://www.cnsnews.com/news/article/susan-jones/record-95102000-americans-not-labor-force-number-grew-18-obama-took-office
Thank you to all the law enforcement officers who put their lives on the line every day to help keep us safe #LawEnforcementAppreciationDay

It is an honor and a privilege to serve the constituents of the Second Congressional District of West Virginia for a second term. As we begin the 115th session of Congress, my top legislative priorities are: fighting the drug epidemic, repealing Obamacare and making healthcare more affordable and accessible, and rolling back anti-coal regulations that have been imposed by President Obama’s Administration.
Happy to welcome the Hodge family to the Capitol today from Hurricane!

Healthcare costs are on the rise because of Obamacare. Obamacare adds burdensome taxes, regulations, and mandates onto American consumers. The American people deserve more patient-centered care, not more bureaucracy. That means more choices, not more mandates.
Today we honor the life, legacy, and impact of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. #MLKDAY  #Ihaveadream

I strongly disagree with Obama's decision to commute Chelsea Manning's sentence. Manning's treacherous actions put American lives at risk.  http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2017/01/17/obama-commutes-chelsea-mannings-sentence-for-leaking-army-documents.html

I had the privilege of meeting Oklahoma Attorney General E. Scott Pruitt last year after he had argued against the job-killing Clean Power Plan in front of the D.C. circuit court. He has promised to put an end to the onerous rules and regulations that the Obama Administration imposed on the American people and the coal industry. I believe that Scott Pruitt will be a great advocate for the fossil fuel industry and will make an outstanding EPA Administrator.

I look forward to working with President Donald Trump and his top notch administration to undo burdensome regulations forced upon the American people by former President Barack Obama.  Working together as Republicans and Democrats, Congress and President Trump will stimulate job growth, protect family values and revitalize the coal industry. It is now time for the country to unite behind our new president and work together to provide opportunities for hard working Americans.
Happy to welcome constituents from across the Second Congressional District to D.C. this afternoon. Here I am with the Toppings from Elkins! #MAGA #inauguration

Great news! Every human life is sacred and should be protected. Proud that President Donald J. Trump is keeping his pro-life promises.   https://www.lifesitenews.com/news/trump-will-end-obama-funding-of-foreign-abortions-by-roe-anniversary-report

Thank you, President Donald J. Trump for clearing the way for the #KeystoneXL. Pipelines are not only a critical component of West Virginia's future but of the future economic security of the United States.  http://thehill.com/policy/energy-environment/315819-trump-to-advance-keystone-dakota-access-pipelines-report
The Hyde amendment is the most successful abortion reduction program yet, saves 60,000 lives a year. That's why I voted for #hr7 #prolife

I believe that all human life is sacred. This week I reintroduced the Life at Conception Act with 57 bipartisan original cosponsors, a record high number. My bill simply codifies a biological fact that life begins at the moment of conception. Like or Share if you agree that life begins at conception.
So happy to see so many West Virginians here in D.C. for #MarchforLife. I #MarchforLife in memory of the 57 million lives that have been lost since '73. #WhyIMarch

I am pleased that President Trump has nominated Judge Neil Gorsuch to the U.S. Supreme Court. The President has lived up to his promise of nominating a traditionalist Judge dedicated to interpreting the Constitution as it was written in the mold of Anthony Scalia.   Judge Gorsuch is a well-respected jurist who had been confirmed unanimously for his previous judicial appointment. I urge the U.S. Senate to confirm him quickly.

Check out my floor speech about repealing the job-killing, so-called stream protection rule. This the first in many steps this Congress, along with President Donald J. Trump, will take to make good on the promises we made in November to fight for West Virginia coal. Friends of Coal West Virginia   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CfIT8JGfWEg
It was great to visit with Dr. Rahul Gupta and Danny Scalise from the West Virginia State Medical Association - WVSMA today in Washington.

Proud to join Speaker Paul Ryan and Rep. Evan Jenkins, David McKinley, Bill Johnson & Chairman Rep. Rob Bishop as the Speaker signed the resolution to roll back an anti-coal Obama regulation. The resolution of disapproval passed the Senate and is now headed to the desk of Donald J. Trump.
Happy Birthday, President Ronald Reagan!
It was great to meet with the WV Rural Water Association & Putnam Public Service District today in Washington.
Let's stay in touch! Sign up to receive my weekly newsletter with updates from Washington.  https://mooney.house.gov/htbin/formproc/contact/newsletter-subscribe%26pass
Congratulations to Dr. Tom Price, an excellent choice to lead the  U.S. Department of Health and Human Services!
Had a great meeting with Vice President Mike Pence last night. I look forward to working with him and President Donald J. Trump on priorities important to West Virginia.
Congratulations to all the performers at the Siegel-Hoffman Piano Concerto Festival held at Shepherd University.   So proud of my daughter Cami for her wonderful performance!
I was honored to join President Donald J. Trump as he signed a resolution to roll back a former President Obama anti-coal regulation.   https://www.facebook.com/WhiteHouse/videos/1225541000866964/
It was great to meet with Highmark West Virginia yesterday to discuss ways to ensure access to quality healthcare for all West Virginians.
Toured Knauf Insulation today in Inwood, glad to hear they are expanding and hiring more workers in the Eastern Panhandle.
Stopped by Mugs & Muffins in downtown Martinsburg, West Virginia this afternoon. What a great small business in the Eastern Panhandle!
It was great to join Hans Fogle this morning on Panhandle Live Wepm 1340 AM. We discussed a wide variety of topics important to West Virginia.
Stopped by to visit Uncle Joe's Barbershop in downtown Martinsburg. The Eastern Panhandle is lucky to have successful small businesses like this!
This week, I hosted a roundtable discussion with job creators and business leaders in the Eastern Panhandle. We discussed ways that unnecessary regulations from Washington are hurting consumers.

Thank you to everyone who joined my telephone town hall last night. We had 6,547 West Virginians participate.   I appreciate hearing the passion and views from my constituents during our productive issue based discussions.
President Donald J. Trump will be addressing a Joint Session of Congress tonight at 9:00 pm. What would you like to hear from our President?

Tonight, President Trump laid out an optimistic agenda that will change America for the better. I am pleased that President Trump is keeping the promises he made to voters in November.   I look forward to continuing to work with President Trump to bring back jobs to communities that have been devastated by the past eight years of former President Obama. #jointaddress
ICYMI: My reaction to President Donald J. Trump's Joint Address to Congress.
It was great to meet with the West Virginia Credit Union League today and discuss ways we can support local credit unions.
Visited today with Shepherd University nursing students. They are a very impressive group with bright futures ahead!

In case you missed it, check out this story from WHAG with my reaction to President Donald J. Trump's first address to Congress.   http://www.your4state.com/news/west-virginia/congressman-mooney-reacts-to-presidents-first-joint-address-to-congress/664959558
Met with some retired UMWA West Virginia coal miners this week and discussed my commitment to fighting to protect their healthcare benefits and pensions.

It was great to welcome so many West Virginians to DC this week. The EveryLife Foundation for Rare Diseases stopped by to discuss funding for rare diseases.   Constituents also came by to promote more research and funding for Parkinson's Disease. The Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson's Research
I was honored to meet with Paralyzed Veterans of America from West Virginia today. We discussed ways we can continue to fulfill our commitments to our veterans and their families.
Had a great time at the West Virginia State Society reception tonight, even answered a few questions.

Glad I was able to visit with West Virginians representing the National Coalition of Black Lung & Respiratory Disease Clinics. I will continue to work hard to ensure we take care of our miners, especially those fighting chronic diseases like black lung.
Always great to catch up with Marshall University President Jerry Gilbert and hear about their good work. Go herd!
Had a great meeting this week with representatives from the West Virginia PTA. We talked about ways to ensure every child receives a quality education.

Check out my interview yesterday with Tom Roten on NewsRadio 800 WVHU. We discussed several hot button issues including Obamacare and immigration.   http://800wvhu.iheart.com/onair/the-tom-roten-morning-show-675/listen-us-rep-alex-mooney-15645550/
Today, I met with Pastors from West Virginia. I am thankful for their prayers and encouragement.

Had a chance to visit with Mary Jo from Charleston this week. She was representing the American Society of Civil Engineers and we discussed about ways to support infrastructure projects in West Virginia.
Honored to receive the U.S. Chamber of Commerce Spirit of Enterprise Award for commitment to free enterprise and economic growth. #SOE17
It was great to meet with West Virginia Council of Trout Unlimited and hear about all of the work they are doing throughout the Second District.
Spent the morning studying the American Health Care Act and reviewing proposed amendments that could change the underlying bill.
Spent some time taking calls from my constituents this morning regarding healthcare.

I was elected by the voters of the Second Congressional District to repeal Obamacare. As Obamacare continues to be the law of the land, more Americans will see it is failing to live up to its promises. I intend to continue working to pass legislation to repeal Obamacare, lower premiums and increases choices for hard working West Virginia taxpayers.
It was great to welcome Vice President Mike Pence to Putnam County today. Glad he was able to visit Foster Supply Inc--one of the many great small businesses in West Virginia!

It was great to visit with AIPAC – The American Israel Public Affairs Committee representatives from West Virginia today. We discussed ways we can continue to stand with our friends and allies in Israel. #AIPAC2017

Today, President Donald Trump signed an Executive Order that rolls back devastating regulations on American energy production.   Check out my full statement here-->  https://mooney.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/congressman-alex-x-mooney-wv-2-responds-president-trump-s-executive
The West Virginia Beverage Association industry employs over 12,000 West Virginians. I was glad to meet with their representatives this week in DC.

Had a great meeting with the West Virginia Primary Care Association today. We discussed ways we can continue to support community health centers that provide excellent care and services to so many West Virginians.
It was great to visit with Tearrianna from Ranson, West Virginia and hear her inspiring story. She was in DC advocating for an increase in musculoskeletal research funding.
I had a great meeting this past weekend with air traffic controllers in Shepherdstown. Air traffic controllers play an important role in keeping our skies safe. NATCA

I strongly condemn the horrific attacks in Syria and look forward to working with President Trump to hold the Bashar al-Assad regime responsible.   https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2017/04/04/syrian-activists-several-dead-idlib-chemical-attack/100013666/

I was glad to accompany two constituents from Jefferson County on a tour of the U.S. Capitol Building today.   If you are planning a trip to Washington, D.C. contact my office and we can help arrange a tour of the U.S. Capitol Building and other monuments.   Visit my website to request a tour-->mooney.house.gov/services/tours-and-tickets

Today, I spoke on the House floor to condemn the horrific attacks this past week in Syria. The slaughter of innocent life will not end unless the United States of America takes the lead.    We must establish safe zones for innocent civilians. Peace in Syria is impossible while Bashar al Assad remains in control.   Check out my full speech ---> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fUf__vsYuhI

I applaud President Trump's decisive action against the Bashar al-Assad regime. The evil chemical attacks this past week against innocent civilians and children warranted a strong military response.   Bashar al-Assad has been put on notice that chemical attacks on the innocent will not be tolerated.
Congratulations, Judge Neil Gorsuch! #scotus
Had a great tour today at St. Patrick's school in Weston with principal Maureen Gildein.

Congratulations to all the participants at the West Virginia National History Day competition this past Saturday in Morgantown.   My son Lucas will represent West Virginia at National History Day in June in the Junior Exhibit Category.
Tune in tonight to WSAZ NewsChannel 3 at 6 p.m. to hear about how I am working to roll back unnecessary regulations from Washington.
I had a great tour of AC & S chemical in Nitro and had a chance to address their employees.   They are one of the many great small businesses located in the Kanawha Valley.

Check out my interview with Tom Roten on NewsRadio 800 WVHU. We discussed a wide variety of issues facing our country and state.   http://800wvhu.iheart.com/onair/the-tom-roten-morning-show-675/listen-us-rep-alex-mooney-15730379/
In honor of National Library Week, I stopped by the Nitro Public Library. The renovations look great!
Check it out----> My thoughts on the recent air strike in Syria.   http://wvmetronews.com/2017/04/10/mooney-strikes-do-not-mean-u-s-will-go-to-war-in-syria/

Stopped by the West Virginia State Senate this past Sunday as they were finishing up their work for this session.   The decisions being made in Charleston will have a major impact on the future of our state.
Recently toured the John Amos Coal Fired Power Plant in Putnam County. I was very impressed by their operations.   West Virginians rely on coal for over 90% of their energy consumption.
Wishing everyone a blessed and Happy Easter.
Recently toured Recovery Point West Virginia's newest facility in Charleston. I was very impressed with the work they do to help those struggling with addiction.
Had a great meeting and tour with the air traffic controllers at Charleston Yeager Airport. We discussed ways we can continue to ensure safe and reliable air travel. NATCA

It was great to catch up with Scott Freshwater, President of the Independent Oil and Gas Association of West Virginia last week in my Charleston office. We talked about ways we can continue to support these small business leaders and job creators.

This week is National Park Week and many parks are offering free admission. This is a great to chance to get outside and explore Wild & Wonderful West Virginia. National Park Service   Visit findyoupark.org to locate a park near you. #findyourpark
I had a great tour of the construction site for the new Proctor & Gamble plant being built near Martinsburg. This will be a big time job creator and economic driver for the entire Eastern Panhandle.

Stopped by Yeager Airport (CRW) to discuss their plans to improve the safety for passengers and the surrounding community. Yeager Airport is a vital hub for the entire state and am proud to have it located in the Second District.
I had a great meeting today with the West Virginia Orthopaedic Society. We discussed ways to reduce cost and improve access to healthcare for patients.
I had a great telephone town hall meeting last night with thousands of West Virginians from all across the Second District. We discussed a wide variety of topics from North Korea to Healthcare.
I was glad to visit with Community Bankers of West Virginia today in DC. I am working hard on the House Committee on Financial Services to fight for West Virginia priorities and our communities.

Great to meet with Dan Weber, President and founder of AMAC - The Association of Mature American Citizens today in Washington. His father was born in Berkeley Springs and still has family there.   There are over 2,100 members in the Second District and we discussed ways to keep drug costs low for seniors.   My mother Lala (who is an AMAC member) also joined the meeting.

Today, I was proud to vote for the American Health Care Act.   Check out my full statement here ----> https://mooney.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/statement-regarding-passage-american-health-care-act

As the investigation continues into the fatal plane crash yesterday at Yeager Airport, I send my thoughts and prayers to the families and loved ones of the victims.   Many thanks to all of the first responders and investigators for their hard work.   http://www.wvgazettemail.com/news/20170505/investigation-into-fatal-plane-crash-at-yeager-airport-continues
Happy Mother's Day!
Stopped by the Walmart in Sutton this morning. It's always great to visit with folks in Braxton County!
Stopped by Ripley today and ran into Mayor Carolyn Rader painting the curb. We talked about ways to address the ongoing waste water plant needs.
Had a fantastic visit at ALL Erection and Crane Rental today in Nitro. It was great to speak with all of their employees and hear their concerns.

Toured the U.S. Department of Agriculture Commodity Food Warehouse in Ripley with staff from the West Virginia Department of Agriculture.   I share Commissioner Kent Leonhardt's goal to get more food from West Virginia farmers in our schools.
Had a great lunch at the Downtowner Restaurant in Ripley. I can personally attest that the peanut buttercup pie is fantastic!
Recently visited with Appalachian Log Structures, Inc. in Ripley. We had a very productive discussion about ways we can continue to support the log home industry.

Today, I spoke on the House Floor to urge my colleagues to join with me in publicly condemning the atrocities committed by the Syrian regime of President Assad. Syrians deserve to be safe and free.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SwKDt_3TUNI&feature=youtu.be
Had a great visit with the West Virginia Association of REALTORS this week. We discussed ways we can continue to promote home ownership and help West Virginia families achieve their American Dream.

Honored to be presented with the Champion of Safe VA Care Award from The American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) by a Doctor from the Second District.    I will continue to work to ensure safe, physician-led anesthesia care for Veterans.
My thoughts and prayers go out to the victims of the horrible attack in Manchester.
Had a fantastic tour of Ecolab in Martinsburg yesterday. I enjoyed seeing their impressive facility and visiting with the employees.

It was an honor to receive the National Association of Manufacturers Award for Manufacturing Legislative Excellence at an event hosted by Ecolab ’s manufacturing plant in Martinsburg.  After the presentation, I was glad to be able to answer questions from my constituents. We covered a wide variety of topics from road funding to the drug epidemic.
Joined my colleagues in the West Virginia Congressional Delegation in welcoming the Always Free Honor Flight to Washington.   We owe a debt of gratitude to our veterans and their families.

Check out my editorial in today's Charleston Gazette-Mail regarding the Financial CHOICE Act.   The Financial CHOICE Act rolls back former President Obama’s harmful policies and replaces them with a better plan that will unleash investment in our economy, grow jobs and put West Virginians back to work.   http://www.wvgazettemail.com/daily-mail-commentary/20170523/alex-mooney-choice-act-will-help-business-growthdaily-mail
It was great to visit with Pastor Mike House and his group from Elkins today. I enjoyed answering their questions on a variety of topics from the budget to the drug epidemic.
It was great to stop by the Hansford Senior Center in Saint Albans a few weeks ago.   Enjoyed chatting about issues important to seniors like protecting Social Security and Medicare.
Today we pause to remember all those who died for our freedom. God Bless America!
My son Lucas is representing West Virginia and the Eastern Panhandle at the Scripps National Spelling Bee this week. The Journal, Martinsburg, WV
Lucas advanced to round two of the Scripps National Spelling Bee by correctly spelling the word rasceta.
Lucas advanced to round three by correctly spelling the word myopic! Scripps National Spelling Bee
I was glad to catch up with representatives from Toyota's plant in Buffalo. I appreciate Toyota's commitment to West Virginia.

Today Congressman Alex Mooney (WV-2) attended President Donald Trump’s announcement about America withdrawing from the Paris Climate Accords at the White House Rose Garden and released the following statement:  “I am proud to see our country declare independence from this international job-killing agreement that disproportionately harms Americans and especially West Virginians. President Trump is fulfilling his promise to grow the economy by putting American jobs and energy needs first. I appreciate that President Trump mentioned the rebounding coal industry and specifically West Virginia in his speech."  “We are seeing an end to an era where foreign anti-job, anti-energy policies, pushed by former President Barack Obama, crush West Virginian jobs. I am proud to have stood with President Trump as he fulfilled his promise to put American jobs first.”  The emissions standards and regulatory requirements under the Paris Accord would cost the U.S. economy nearly $3 trillion over the next several decades while also destroying 6.5 million industrial sector jobs.
Congratulations to all the Scripps National Spelling Bee participants from West Virginia!   Lucas finished in 41st place and we are very proud of him!
Take a moment today to remember the honor and sacrifice those brave soldiers made 73 years ago.
Great visit with AARP West Virginia's State Director & President from Charleston, look forward to continuing to work with them to protect seniors.

Check out my Connect to Congress interview with Kennie Bass with WCHS & WVAH TV. We discussed a wide variety of topics from healthcare to the Financial CHOICE Act.   http://wchstv.com/news/connect-to-congress/connect-to-congress-wv-congressman-alex-mooney

Just spoke on the House floor in support of H.R. 10 - The Financial CHOICE Act.   This bill will remove power from out-of-touch Washington bureaucrats and return financial decision making to individual consumers and small community banks.   Read more about it here --> FinancialCHOICE.gop  House Committee on Financial Services  https://youtu.be/-5hx2d3UaYM

Check out my full statement on the passage of H.R. 10 - The Financial CHOICE Act --->   https://mooney.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/congressman-alex-x-mooney-wv-02-applauds-passage-financial-choice-act  House Committee on Financial Services

It is always great to visit with Rabbi Victor Urecki from Charleston and my friends from AIPAC – The American Israel Public Affairs Committee. I am proud to stand with Israel.

It is always great to visit with members of the Home Builders Association of West Virginia. We talked about ways we can support these local job creators and encourage home building. National Association of Home Builders Eastern Panhandle Home Builders Association
Congratulations to all of the winners from West Virginia at the National History Day competition. My son Lucas won Best in State in the Junior division.
Happy Father's Day!
Happy 154th Birthday West Virginia!
We had another great telephone town hall meeting this evening. Thank you to the thousands of West Virginians that joined and asked questions from all across the Second District.

It was my pleasure to meet with the West Virginia Nature Conservancy today in Washington. We discussed the importance or outdoor recreation to West Virginia and ways we can continue to support those activities.

Check out this MetroNews article regarding my work on the House Committee on Financial Services to reform the flood insurance program.   http://wvmetronews.com/2017/06/21/mooney-praises-house-committee-work-on-flood-insurance/

I had a very productive meeting and discussion with Associated Builders and Contractors, West Virginia Chapter this week. We talked about ways we can reduce unnecessary federal regulations that hinder small business growth.

The ongoing drug epidemic is impacting so many West Virginia families. I was glad to be able to visit with my constituents and staff from Tree House Recovery today to discuss ways we can improve treatment and support families.

I was pleased to vote for two bills that will return the rule of law to our country and increase penalties for deported felon illegal immigrants who return to our country and commit further crimes. My youngest daughter Gabby had a great time today at the Clay Center for the Arts & Sciences of West Virginia.

Great discussion with local business leaders this morning at my breakfast roundtable in Charleston.

Proud to work with Donald J. Trump to roll back the oppressive regulatory regime left behind by former President Obama that would have destroyed thousands of West Virginia jobs.   https://mooney.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/congressman-alex-x-mooney-wv-02-praises-passage-bill-delay

I am proud to announce that my office was able to assist the Chelyan Public Service District in obtaining a $975,000 grant from the Army Corps of Engineers to make much needed waste water infrastructure improvements.   These funds will be used to provide sewer service to nearly 600 homes in the Lens Creek area in Eastern Kanawha County.   Improving water and sewer infrastructure is critical to the development of Eastern Kanawha County and I will continue to fight in Congress to make sure federal funding is available.    Section 571 of the Water Resources Development Act of 1999 provides a federal assistance program through the Army Corps of Engineers for projects in Central West Virginia.
I have resumed my bike ride across the Second District. I started today in Moorefield in Hardy County. It's a beautiful day for a ride!
Dropped by WELD near Moorefield today during my bike ride across the Second District. Also had the chance to join The Steve Davis show for a segment!

My daughter had one of the leading roles in a theatre production at Black Box in Sheperdstown last night. I am so proud of her and enjoyed watching her and all the other talented West Virginia actors.
Stopped by the Montrose Bluegrass Festival on the way to Elkins!

Great news! Under the leadership of President Donald J. Trump, coal is making a comeback! I will continue to fight to bring back coal jobs to West Virginia.   http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2017/08/20/pennsylvania-coal-company-to-open-second-mine-since-trump-took-office.amp.html

In case you missed President Donald J. Trump's fantastic speech in Arizona last night, check out his comments about West Virginia.   Under former President Obama, our state was suffering. President Trump is working to reverse the damage and bring back coal and jobs to West Virginia!   "And the state of West Virginia, which was way behind and lagging, was now, in terms of GDP increase, second last quarter to the state of Texas. How about that? West Virginia."
Great news! President Donald J. Trump just signed into law a bill that will help ensure veterans receive the care they have earned.

Did you know that my Washington, DC office can help you purchase an American flag flown over the U.S. Capitol Building?  Visit my website (mooney.house.gov) or call my office 202-225-2711 to find out more!

President Donald J. Trump continues to keep his promises to West Virginia by rolling back this Obama-era extreme environmental regulation. The so-called Clean Power Plan was a nightmare for the West Virginia coal industry and would increase home energy prices for American consumers.  For eight years, former President Barack Obama waged an all-out war on coal and West Virginia values. As unemployment skyrocketed and coal mines closed, President Obama and his left-wing supporters focused on executing on his promise to bankrupt the coal industry.  Thankfully, President Trump realizes that we can reduce burdensome regulations on energy production and protect our environment. U.S. Environmental Protection Agency

On October 24, 1861, residents of western Virginia who were loyal to the Union during the Civil War voted overwhelmingly to create a new state. Originally named ‘Kanawha’ by the Wheeling Convention, the new state authorized by the vote would be renamed West Virginia. The only state created by seceding from a Confederate state, West Virginia embodied the ideals of patriotism and freedom from the beginning.

Last night, I joined my colleagues in encouraging the United States Senate to act on over 270 House passed bills that have stalled in that chamber. I specifically highlighted the Financial CHOICE Act which rolls back job-killing and small business crushing regulations from Obama's Dodd-Frank legislation.   House Committee on Financial Services
Another fantastic telephone town hall meeting with constituents from ALL 17 counties. The hot topics were the recently released tax reform bill and protecting social security and medicare.

Rep. Alex Mooney (R-WV) said that the House passed the Financial Choice Act, which would have repealed many sections of the Obama-era Dodd-Frank Act. Mooney charged, “Dodd-Frank was what Obamacare was to the healthcare market.”   The Financial Choice Act would eliminate provisions in Dodd-Frank that would allow for future bailouts of large Wall Street banks in the event of a future financial crisis.  “Most Americans think that Americans should not bail out failing banks,” Mooney added.  “We no longer have conference committees in Congress anymore,” he said. “We simply want the Senate to do their job, and we can work out the differences in the conference committee.”  http://www.breitbart.com/big-government/2017/11/02/rep-ken-buck-conservatives-chastise-senate-holding-300-house-passed-bills-urge-senate-drop-filibuster/

It has been over 30 years since President Ronald Reagan signed into law the nation’s largest tax overhaul.  It is well past due that we modernize our tax code and provide relief to all hardworking West Virginians.

What would you do with an extra $2,059 per year?  That's the average tax cut a family of four will receive under the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act. This bill means more money in the pockets of hard working West Virginia tax payers!

Today, I will be voting for the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act.   The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act means an average family of four will receive a $2,059 tax cut—that means more money in the pockets of all Americans.
